Take Two

12 October 2015

Here we go again.

Trying the blogging thing once more. I’m adding a portfolio and an about section this time around too! I’ve been toying with it all summer, and I’ve finally gotten what I think is a clean and elegant solution.

Hopefully this will be a nice dumping ground for my thoughts and musings. Things I want to write that are too long for Twitter or that no one wants to read.

I’ll still publish some of my more thought-out posts here as well, but I’m not sure yet whether I’ll separate them from everything else. Maybe I’ll add a section for “writing” or something like that. We’ll see.

I’ve been playing around with this whole static site generator thing, and it’s pretty great. It gives me all the benefits of templates and the speed of static sites—no need to rely on a server or database. It’s perfect for my small-scale needs. And it gives me full control over design and functionality too. I love it. I’m using a program called Jekyll which is a very popular, well-documented, and GitHub-friendly solution. Maybe I’ll write a longer post about it in the future.

For now, though, here’s to take two of my blogging adventures!

HOME
